rComments: I loved this class, made me have a different view on writing.
don't get on her bad side because if you do shell watch you constantly. for the most part the majority of her prompts are uninteresting.

Farnaz is an amazing teacher. She helped me DRASTICALLY improve my writing. She is a bit of a hard ass, so if you aren't prepared to work and are sensitive to criticism, then too bad. She doesn't tolerate BS so leave it at the door. If you come to class ready and try your hardest, Farnaz will grade you against YOU and not the rest of the class.

I had Professor Fatemi for two courses.  Before entering her course, I was a really horrible writer.  I did not write with an open mind or heart which is really crucial in writing a good paper. She saw ambition in me and believed in me.

I took the comic book class back in Winter 05. Farnaz was very nice. There was a lot of reading and writing, but it is a writing course after all. I did notice that certain students rubbed her the wrong way. I suggest that anyone taking a class with her leave their attitude at the door. All in all, this was in my top 3 favorite classes at UCSC.

Farnaz was a great core professor! She likes to build relationships with her students and cares about them. She is clear about assignments and down to earth. She will totally give you an easy A if you pay attention in class, turn in all assignments, and get on her good side!

I believe I would've gotten a n A if I didn't choose to do pass/fail. I only choose to do so because the workload was unimaginable and Farnaz took a disliking to me the moment the class started. Also, mandatory grading on others work is pointless and she didn't grade anything on her own. horrible teacher, fun subject.

Really good teacher if you're interested in comics. However there's so much work involved that it effected my other classes. wastes paper. she let's you get off on a lot (turning papers in late) if you're on her good side. make sure you like comics. mandatory group session.

Franaz is the worst teacher ever. She makes you do plenty of useless work. If you want a easy class, this is not it. If you want to maintain a high gpa, do not take this class. If you like comics, i suggest you think carefully before taking this class. Don't get on her bad side. Go to office hours frequently and find out your grade.

Definitely not a great teacher. Once you catch her attention in a bad way, she watches you like a hawk. Just a warning, a ton of homework is assigned in this class. If you're very interested in the topic of her class, then take it; if not, AVOID AT ALL COSTS. If you want to keep a good GPA, don't take this class.

Frustratingly nit-picky on essays, frustratingly boring prompts, style textbook teaches shortening of sentences while essay requirements are long, meticulous about attendance/tardiness, kinda creepy up-close, lots and lots of work, DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS. (writing 2)

Farnaz really cared and was committed to helping in any way she could.  The final project was fun and made me feel accomplished. The material was really fascinating and I've kept most of the graphic novels we studied even though I took the course last winter.
terrible teacher and unfair grader

Thought comic books would be fun, but no. Unbearably boring and pointless, and lots of work, Farnaz was also unusually tough on less-than-willing students. Once she didn't like you, expectations for participation and attitude skyrocketed and it mercilessly became do-or-die. Couldn't breathe. One of the worst experiences ever, dropped it after 4 wks

good lecture, class is student run. gets extremely upset if the the students aren't discussing/talking in class. Doesnt really help out on essay (you're better off getting a writing tutor) but care a lot about the student-teacher relationship. Value you as a person more than a student.
not too good, not too bad.  not the worst teacher, not the best.
I had Farnaz for two different classes and they were both wonderful. I learned a lot and really felt like she gave me room to do my own thing and expand my learning experience

Great teacher,REALLY respects students + learning.Classes are student directed, which was a little frusterating at first, because I felt that I would have learned more from a lecture, but she does because she values students say and I did learn a lot.  Very good at boasting writing confidence.
Very pointless class. There was lots of essays and meetings for this class too.  The class basically is liberal propaganda and brainwashing.  Not very fun at all.

The class, while somewhat boring, was helpful with tutoring, especially the readings. Farnaz worked really hard at finding answers to questions and helping them out with tutoring. The discussions were interesting and well-facilitated. Perhaps it would be better if we only met once a week.

Seminar was very pointless, basically did not do a good job of leading discussion. There were several times where we were totally off topic, but she just sat there. The most pointless class I have ever taken in my academic career. Total waste of my time.
